blocks.text: Non-repudiation ensures that an individual cannot deny performing a specific action. It provides proof that a message, transaction, or request originated from a particular entity.
Digital signatures are a common method for providing non-repudiation. When a user signs data using a private key, anyone can verify the signature using the corresponding public key.
Hash functions support non-repudiation by ensuring data integrity. If even a small change occurs, the hash value will differ, revealing tampering.
Audit logs also contribute to non-repudiation by recording events, timestamps, and system actions, allowing investigators to reconstruct activity.
